data.title: Great BB Pistol
data.body: I am very happy with this CO2 BB Pistol. It is fairly accurate for a BB gun. You can't expect a round ball to fly straight, but it does pretty good. It looks like a real pistol, it has the weight of a real pistol, it is hard to tell that it is not a real pistol until you get a close look at it. It is fun to shoot and easy to reload. I purchased an extra clip so I can have plenty of shots all ready to go when I am plinking at sticks floating down the river. A CO2 container gives around 70 to 80 shots before you can really tell they are slowing down and its time for a new cartridge. Overall I think that this was a pretty good BB pistol, and a pretty good price too.

data.title: Son loves it
data.body: My 13 year old son absolutely lovees this gun. It looks so realistic and feels like the perfect weight. It shoots very accurately and is a blast to use. It isn't the easiest thing to load, making it tough for beginners, and the magazine only holds 30 or so BBs, so frequent reloading is needed. Overall, an amazing product, though.

data.title: shoot steel BBs at a velocity of up to 410 feet per second
data.body:
The Glock 19 Gen3 .177 Caliber BB Gun Air Pistol is an excellent replica of the real Glock 19 handgun. This air pistol is designed to shoot steel BBs at a velocity of up to 410 feet per second, making it an ideal option for target shooting and plinking.

One of the best things about this air pistol is its accuracy. The design of the pistol closely resembles the real Glock 19, and it has a fixed front sight and a rear sight that is adjustable for windage and elevation. This makes it easy to aim and shoot accurately, even at longer distances.

The Glock 19 Gen3 .177 Caliber BB Gun Air Pistol is also well-made. It is constructed of high-quality materials that are durable and built to last, and it has a comfortable grip that is easy to hold and control. The pistol also has a smooth trigger pull that is easy to operate.

Another great feature of this air pistol is its realism. The Glock 19 Gen3 .177 Caliber BB Gun Air Pistol has a similar weight and feel to the real Glock 19, making it an excellent option for training and practicing gun handling and shooting skills. It also has a realistic blowback action that simulates the recoil of a real firearm.

Overall, the Glock 19 Gen3 .177 Caliber BB Gun Air Pistol is a great option for anyone who wants to practice their shooting skills or enjoy some target shooting or plinking. Its accuracy, quality, and realism make it an excellent value for the price, and its durable design ensures that it will last for years to come.

data.title: Fantastic gun. Magazine blows goats.
data.body:
Bought this little thing for target practice and plinking. Beyond pleasantly surprised for the first 3 days. Shot exceptionally accurate considering it's not only a pistol, but a BB pistol. Pretty comfy in the hand too, especially if you have big meaty claws like I do. However, my joy was short lived when SOMETHING in the magazine that came with it busted. It has 2 major issues. After putting... I'd say just 10 magazines through the gun, the spring used to feed the BBs kept slipping, resulting in all 15 pellets begin violently shot out of the magazine. It was actually pretty funny at first. "Hey look! The magazine is its own little gun!" Once the joke wasn't funny anymore, it quickly just became infuriating. Loading the gun was finicky at best, and 9 times out of 10, the spring would slip and shoot the BBs into the grip of the gun. I'd have to dump em all out and start again. The second issue was that the retention peg (idk what else to call it) that kept the BBs inside the magazine when the feeding spring was released quickly wore out and frankly just didn't work at all. The experience quickly degraded into just a frustrated ginger spending more time trying to load the gun than actually firing the thing.

VALUE FOR MONEY - if it weren't for the magazine, this would be fantastic for the price, but I simply don't feel like blowing 12 bucks on another magazine every 3 days.

FOR BEGINNERS - trigger is almost *too* hard to pull after more than 20 minutes of straight shooting. Fairly niche scenario (thus a niche complaint) but something to watch out for. It's also worth mentioning that the safety on the trigger kinda sucks. Certainly gets the job done, but it's not labeled all that well and it feels kinda mushy. A nice "click" would not only be satisfying, but reassuring. Nothing much worse than flipping a switch and not being sure it got flipped properly... Especially when it controls whether or not a GUN CAN BE FIRED.

data.title: Awesome
data.body: No wonder it’s a best seller. I got it, it preforms beautifully, looks real , feels like a real gun when holding it. It’s pretty powerful. Love it. It is great fun.

data.title: Absolutely perfect
data.body: The first thing that I noticed is this thing is exactly like a Glock 19, just with a smaller barrel. Easy to load with great compression and the sites were literally on point right out of the packaging. This is actually cheaper than what you would buy actually in the store. Easy to load, and the clip holds 15 BBs. It's got a decent weight to it and is very well balanced. Perfect for somebody who's just starting out and wanting to learn how to shoot and get familiar with guns of any kind. I have another pellet gun from this company and this Glock 19 is now my new favorite. Just a whole lot of fun.

data.title: Accurate and fun
data.body: Very accurate, a lil too realistic I fooled a couple of glock owners with it. But tons of fun, hate living in the city and not being able to shoot it as much.

data.title: Features:
data.body: Gun Has Good Weight To It, Good Design Looks Like A Real One But Does Not Function As Such. Does Not Cock Back Is My Only Problem. The Safety Itself Is On The Trigger.

data.title: Great in every respect except one
data.body: The BB gun has a great feel and weight. It is very close to an actual Glock in those regards. Very accurate. Great for inexpensive target practice at a fraction of the cost of the real thing. I like everything about it except the "clip" that holds the BB's. There is a little thumbhold for compressing the spring so you can load the BB's into the clip. There is also a warning in the instructions to NOT let the spring freely decompress. It is virtually impossible to consistently prevent that from happening. First, while there is a locking notch for the spring compressor, it routinely spontaneously (or at the slightest vibration) causing the rapid spring decompression; and second, even with my thumb on the little nub, the little nub has such a low profile that it slips out from under my thumb. This is bad for two reasons: 1. It sends the BB's that were loaded to all come out of the top of the clip, sending the bb's dancing around the room. 2. More importantly, it damages the clip (which is what the warning is about) so much so that even if you very carefully allow the spring to decompress, the top of the clip will no longer retain the bb's and again the bb's dance around the room. You will find those bb's later when you're walking around barefoot. I called Umarex with this general concern. They were very nice and helpful and immediately offered to send me a replacement clip (with the return of the current one). That is nice and appropriate (I haven't sent it yet), but I doubt it's going to fix the problem. I am trying to design some sort of bracket or stop that will prevent that sudden decompression.

data.title: Heavy metal
data.body: I needed a new BB gun so bought this one on Amazon. Very surprised at how accurate to the Glock 19. Right up to the annoying safety trigger. Heavy but well made.

data.title: MEh...Not bad at all "For The Price" Def looks like & can be mistaken for a real one
data.body:
2 of my friends, Both in their mid 20's, thought it was a real gun even looking at barrel end, because bb port is recessed.
They didn't notice it did not have a hammer.
One even fired it , then said - WAIT - WHAT THE FREAK???
What kind of bullet is THAT?
I told him it was new military Gas fired.. But then let him off the hook.... lol
It doesn't have quite as much power as I thought it would - BUT it is a pistol.
I do not think it would penetrate skin after 7-10ft away. Not going to see if it will @ 0-10 . LoL

data.title: Fun And Realistic
data.body: A fun BB gun with similar weight and feel of the real thing. Deducted one star because the plastic blister pack it comes in is so difficult to open you will want to use the product on yourself!

I do instacart and Doordash and being a 4 ft 11 female I felt I needed something with me to protect my self from any danger. I have pulled it out once before at a gas station and the people harassing me sped off. It's something I wouldn't hesitate to shoot neither cause I know it wouldn't kill anybody. It's perfect for when you want something that looks a Like a gun but isn't.

data.title: At 1st Glance it’s a Real Glock
data.body:
Whoa baby! This sleek black Glock is the real deal. Even made by Glock. The finest BB gun pistol I’ve ran across in 20 years. The grip is true, weight is perfect and honestly the only tell it’s not a real Glock.
As for the shot. The aim is dead on. And you can fire off your entire mag in about 2 second. Not loud but noticeable.
Ok it’s not perfect. I’ve owned 2 and both have had the same issue in my opinion. 1, you really need to slam the magazine into place. And 2 the back flap where the Co2 cartridge goes falls off rather easily. I’d like to see it lock into place.

data.title: BB CONTINUALLY GETS STUCK IN CHAMBER
data.body: Purchased in 2020 after a couple pit bulls were loose on our lake property. Wanted something that would sting but not injure - unfortunately after maybe 30 test firings discovered a silver BB keeps getting stuck inside the chamber and I can't get it out - when I remove the BB holder from the gun a BB falls out - I'm constantly replacing the air cartridges because no matter how tight I screw in the new cannister they leak. I do love how easy it is to load the BB's and air cannisters - and the weight of the product in my hand - a word of caution - it's a bit scary how real the Glock BB gun looks and feels (I'm told).

data.title: IT LOOKS LIKE A REAL GUN.. AND COULD GET YOU HURT.
data.body:
Umarex Glock 19 Gen3 .177 Caliber BB Gun Air Pistol
The weight and appearance are hard to tell the difference from an official Glock gun. It could be mistaken for a real gun and get you killed, or arrested. Be careful.

data.title: Seems like a fine practice tool, mine was potentially opened.
data.body:
You can see in the pictures that there is quite a bit of damage to the package. To me it looks as if it was ripped open and potentially used before I got it. I was able to pull the item out from the package through the damaged section without widening it so that doesn't seem too far-fetched but that's just an assumption, not something easily provable.

Aside from that, it seems fine. No visible damage to the item itself and it seems to operate just fine. I haven't yet had a chance to chronograph it or test how many mags I can get per CO2 cartridge, so my review of the item itself is regrettably pretty surface-level.

The weight is very nice, not too far off real steel. As a result, it handles well and realistically. Perhaps a little heavy for a young user, but as much as this *is not a toy*, it is definitely safer to practice form, aim, and safety with than a real Glock. Also cheaper and more convenient.

I haven't had a chance to extensively test accuracy, if I don't update this then it's fair to assume it's perfectly fine. Same goes for longevity.

data.title: the fast delivery
data.body: supper fast delivery it said 2 days, but it came in one day and it is a really good product and would recommend.

data.title: Overall pretty good
data.body:
Overall very nice and looks exactly like a G19. However, this does not fit correctly in any if my kydex IWB Glock 19 holsters. It seems the slide is just slightly wider and more square and therefor it binds going in the holsters. This wad a real bummer for me because I purchased this to practice my Glock 19 draw.

One other small grip is, when the magazine has BBs in it and is in the gun, if you release the magazine, one BB will always fall out and on to the ground. This is annoying aspect of the design. Let's say for instance you take only a few shots and then want to fully reload again, you release the magazine a BB will fall out wherever you may be standing or sitting.

However, overall I think it's a sturdy well built CO2 powered BB gun. I haven't shot it enough to speak on the wear and tear or the accuracy yet.

data.title: Are you serious?😆
data.body:
Play Video
All is well with the Glock, I am happy with it. Nevertheless, the way that it came to me is an abomination. I couldn't believe the way that it arrived. It's as if a bear tried to claw its way inside my airsoft gun. Who would open up a packaging this tough? Only a theif, or perhaps a temper tantrum. I struggle with scissors to open this extremely tough plastic, so it makes me wonder how hard they had to hit it against something to break it. Umarex, Glock, and Amazon all are responsible for not caring about their customers. Lame people=Lame results.

The gun has a nice weight, easy to set up, solid aim, plenty of velocity with a fresh cartridge. The place where this gun fall flat is the loading and overall lack of proper functionality of the clip. It frequently unloads as you’re attaching the loaded clip to the gun, also when you’re adding bbs: I’d recommend under filling the clip:

data.title: Online manual is outdated
data.body: The package was missing the manual on the first delivery. I looked the manual up online and the one listed for this model wasn’t correct. So I could not get the trigger to function. I returned it as malfunctioning, and got a replacement. This one had a manual, and low and behold, the dang thing had a manual safety on the trigger that looked like a pin. I know Glock has the Mashable trigger safely, but this is a separate device. Anyway, now that I know about it, the first one is probably good to go. So if someone is quick, they might get the one I returned for a good price. The first photo is the manual safety, the second is the typical Glock style trigger safety. You have to push the manual safety from the opposite side, and it will move slightly bad have a red ring barely visible, see third photo.

data.title: Buy At Your Own Risk!
data.body:
Play Video
Gun doesn't work at all. Sucks because I was excited about it and when it finally got here the most important features dont function. Won't hold bbs and the air tanks leak badly! Wasted 7 air tanks since thinking it was my fault. No. Came packaged well and didn't look tampered with. Couldn't contact Umarex or sellers so I recieved refund and will try again. *'crosses fingers* Second time ordering because it was a beautiful gun and fit perfectly in my hand. Plus the weight from the metal was nice. It came shipped in a package and the glock package itself was slightly damaged and so was the gun as in a few light scraps but nothing major. The bottom where the screw to the air tank went seemed prelubed which didn't bother me saying that I'd prefer it being tested this time lol! It shoots perfectly! And ITS LOUD!! LOVE IT!! I was refunded quickly and had it delivered just as efficiently. Incase you get a faulty gun the first time try reordering. Will update again.

data.title: Remember the three P's. Practice, practice, practice.
data.body: Worked well the first day. Then the magazine started emitting the BB's before I could insert it in the gun. Called Umarex and sent the magazine back to them. They sent me back a replacement but it was a 6mm magazine. I called Umarex and the service technician told me that that magazine would not be compatible with my 4.5 mm gun. The service tech told me he was mailing a new 4.5 mm magazine to me. Hope this one works! Waiting patiently for the arrival. The iquana population is surging in my backyard.

data.title: Poor cartridge design
data.body: This BB gun has a number of very positive points about it. However, it has one very big flaw: it develops a leak problem with the seat of the cartridge. Cartridges that are put in, no matter how snugly you seat it, leak terribly. Soon, you cannot get a cartridge to stay in without leaking and the gun is useless.

data.title: Great Pistol
data.body: While it lacks blowback action and features a stick bb magazine instead of a more realistic box-type mag as featured in the green gas airsoft version, it makes up for its shortcomings with its near spot-on weight, smooth trigger pull and a significantly higher shot velocity (400+fps 4.5mm vs. 300fps 6mm airsoft). The anodised metal slide, clean flat black finish, recessed barrel and authentic Glock branding are very realistic. Maybe too realistic. Lacking blaze orange muzzle markings of its airsoft cousin, you may want to think twice about gifting one of these to young or novice shooters. That said, the Glock 19 bb pistol is literally a blast to shoot for plinking fun or as a backup for keeping your property free of varmints. But take the warning info printed under the trigger guard to heart and realise that it is not a toy and should be given the same respect and precautions as it’s center fire big brother.

data.title: It’s “ok”, could be better
data.body:
It could be better , the safety on the trigger , well the push button safety feels weird since you have to push it from left to right , and being right handed it gets in the way of your trigger finger .
Should have just left it like the real pistol (safety tab on the trigger itself ) .
Next no blow back , no slide racking ability .
Only 1 mag

Said 18 rounds , but in the fine print it’s actually only 15 , and if you squeeze 16 in , it won’t work (shoot)

Now the good: the weight does feel good , it’s ok on accuracy, will have to see how far I can push this out to and to see how many shots per co2 .

data.title: Glock 19 bb gun
data.body:
This gift made a young man very happy this Christmas. Thank you
It was exactly what he wanted

data.title: Good practice weapon but has its flaws
data.body:
I have put several hundred rounds through this weapon since it was delivered. Overall it met my expectations with a few exceptions.

The build quality is excellent and the feel is close to an actual G19. However, the trigger has a pronounced engagement point in which the magazine is forced against the chamber. You can feel it moving around in the grip. This results in less than accurate shots until you learn to deal with it. However, that being said accuracy is better than expected for a BB gun at ten yards or so.

The weapon is actually quite powerful with a full CO2 cartridge and delivers acceptable accuracy through most of the cartridge life.

The sight picture is virtually identical to a real G19.

My biggest disappointment with the weapon is that the slide is slightly larger than the actual G19's making it impossible to use in the close fitting kydex holsters I use for my real G19. This makes it impossible to use for drills that involve drawing the weapon.

Overall, for the price the weapon is an adequate training tool especially given the high price of ammunition lately.

data.title: Absolutely beautiful , Trade off between speed & blowback
data.body: First of all I can't describe how impressed and happy I am with the quality, feel, weight, look of this piece of equipment. To top that off, it is very wise for the designer to gain a substantial amount of speed (FPS) on the BB by trading off with the blow back action (personally I think the rush feeling of blow back will fade eventually). I don't know the pistol has a rifle barrel, or a way to top-spin the BB so to rise a bit as it travel toward the target. But whatever it is, this baby is impressively accurate. I can buy several Gen3 - 17 just to keep it in pristine condition as collection. This baby should win many awards.

data.title: VIDEO FOR USING GUN WAS INCORRECT
data.body: I watched the video that was presented in the advertisement for the Glock 19. When I watched the video I was learning how to use the gun and during the reloading of the Glock 19 I found out that it is absolutely not how you load this Glock 19. I placed BBs in the wrong area of the Mag, almost ruining the gun. My dad stopped me before I placed too many BBs in the wrong area. I was able to watch another video that showed me the correct way to load the Glock 19 and it works OK but not as well as I would like it to. I am very disappointed in the video that was presented in this advertisement because again it is not how you load this product. I would not recommend this BB gun. I just wanted other people to know that the video is very misleading and shows you the wrong way to load the gun. thanks

data.title: Metal replacement magazine. Working fine now, we will see.
data.body: Worked fine for 2 weeks. Now the BB magazine will not hold BBs

data.title: You Can't go wrong
data.body: Best customer support..ever

data.title: Love how glock makes its own bb guns well worth it
data.body: I love how glock makes its own bb guns and how they make them look so real, the only thing is that the slide doesn't move back. The sights and the body structure is so alike to a real handgun, fits in my hand perfect but I actually ordered it with the 40 pack of Co2 tanks and they never arrived even tho it said that they handed It to me. Was not able to test the accuracy since I didn't get everything I purchased which is frustrating and that's the whole reason why I got the bundle so it arrives together. So the Co2 tank happens to be a third party so it makes no sense to put it in the bundle if it doesn't get shipped at the same time, the bb gun arrived first then the Co2 tanks were supposed to arrive some day later but didn't which doesn't make sense. I recommend just ordering the gun it self so you don't get the same issue I ran into plus there's no option for a refund how stupid.

data.title: Realistic
data.body: I like the feel of this BB gun. We're using it as a prop, so it is very realistic. I just have to learn about gun laws in my state to make sure that I am not breaking any laws.

data.title: no clue
data.body: i tried to put co2 in it and they all exploded for some odd reason

data.title: Best AirGun I've ever bought
data.body: Best AirGun I've ever bought. And I've bought many. This Glock 19 Gen 3 replica, .177 caliber, 4.5mm, Co2 powered bb gun is extremely impressive. Cheap for the amazing quality. Owned 3 of them and never had a problem. Accurate, but not quite to a T. Though, it is a perfect bb gun for target practice. And dry fire does not ruin anything about this gun. The way I took it apart is by the screw at the bottom of the barrel next to the serial number. Unscrew the screw, pull the slide towards the direction you would normal pull a slide, then pull up to remove the slide. May have to wiggle it a little, but it comes off and will very easily go back on the same way you take it off. Amazing feel. Fits the hand like it's ment to be. Easy to use. The list goes on, but overall, an amazing buy. Definitely recommend this to anyone who wants a great target practice experience. And I have taken it for rabbit hunting and squirrel hunting. It will kill. So do be careful when handling this bb gun. And for anyone who thinks it's a good idea to carry one of these as self defense, I do not suggest it. Because someone could have the real thing and hurt you a lot worse than the Glock 19 Gen 3 replica bb gun will.

data.title: love them
data.body: What a air pistol. Great buy and great fun

data.title: Looks real
data.body: This BB gun looks exactly like my 9mm Glock 19, with the exception of some writing. So far it seems to be pretty accurate when using it for target practice with only the sights. I will probably buy the laser attachment since I'm after the pterodactyl that keeps visiting my pond.
